name: Sun
description: The Sun is the star at the center of our Solar System. Diameter: 1,392,700 km (109x Earth). Note: Size compressed for visualization.
fun_facts: The Sun contains 99.86% of the mass in our Solar System
About 1.3 million Earths could fit inside the Sun
The Sun is 4.6 billion years old
Light from the Sun takes 8 minutes to reach Earth

name: Mercury
description: Mercury is the smallest planet. Distance: 57.9 million km (0.39 AU). Diameter: 4,879 km (0.38x Earth).
fun_facts: Mercury has no atmosphere to retain heat, causing extreme temperature swings
A year on Mercury is just 88 Earth days, but a day lasts 176 Earth days
Mercury is the smallest planet since Pluto was reclassified
It has a massive iron core making up 75% of its radius

name: Venus
description: Venus is the hottest planet at 462Â°C. Distance: 108.2 million km (0.72 AU). Diameter: 12,104 km (0.95x Earth).
fun_facts: Venus rotates backwards compared to most planets
A day on Venus is longer than its year
Venus is the hottest planet despite Mercury being closer to the Sun
It rains sulfuric acid on Venus, but it evaporates before reaching the ground

name: Earth
description: Earth is the only planet with life. Distance: 149.6 million km (1 AU). Diameter: 12,756 km.
fun_facts: Earth is the only known planet with liquid water on its surface
The Earth's core is as hot as the surface of the Sun
A year is actually 365.25 days, hence leap years
Earth is the densest planet in our Solar System

name: Mars
description: Mars, the Red Planet. Distance: 227.9 million km (1.52 AU). Diameter: 6,792 km (0.53x Earth).
fun_facts: Mars has the largest volcano in the Solar System: Olympus Mons
A day on Mars is 24.6 hours, very similar to Earth
Mars has two moons: Phobos and Deimos
The red color comes from iron oxide (rust) on its surface

name: Jupiter
description: Jupiter is the largest planet. Distance: 778.3 million km (5.20 AU). Diameter: 142,984 km (11.2x Earth, compressed).
fun_facts: Jupiter is so big that all other planets could fit inside it
The Great Red Spot is a storm that has lasted over 350 years
Jupiter has 95 known moons
A day on Jupiter is only 10 hours long

name: Saturn
description: Saturn with its famous rings. Distance: 1.426 billion km (9.54 AU). Diameter: 120,536 km (9.4x Earth, compressed).
fun_facts: Saturn's rings are made of ice and rock particles
Saturn is the least dense planet and would float in water
Saturn has 146 confirmed moons
Wind speeds on Saturn can reach 1,800 km/h

name: Uranus
description: Uranus rotates on its side. Distance: 2.870 billion km (19.2 AU). Diameter: 51,118 km (4x Earth, compressed).
fun_facts: Uranus rotates on its side at a 98-degree angle
A year on Uranus is 84 Earth years
Uranus was the first planet discovered with a telescope
It has 13 known rings and 27 known moons

name: Neptune
description: Neptune is the windiest planet. Distance: 4.498 billion km (30.06 AU). Diameter: 49,528 km (3.9x Earth, compressed).
fun_facts: Neptune has the strongest winds in the Solar System: up to 2,100 km/h
It was discovered through mathematical predictions before being observed
A year on Neptune is 165 Earth years
Neptune has 14 known moons, the largest being Triton

name: Moon
description: Earth's Moon orbits at ~384,400 km from Earth. Diameter: 3,475 km (0.27x Earth).
fun_facts: The Moon is gradually moving away from Earth at 3.8 cm per year
The same side of the Moon always faces Earth
There is no dark side of the Moon, all sides get sunlight
The Moon's gravity causes Earth's ocean tides
